trial_identification.studytitle: A study of the efficacy of text messages in preventing BMI gain in young children
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomized control trial of a text message-based intervention on body mass index change in overweight children aged 3 to 6 years

interventions.interventions: 1. a leaflet containing general information on obesity and health impacts, tips on healthy eating and healthy life style for the preschool children given at the baseline 2. short text messages containing reminders about healthy eating and healthy life style sending to parents everyday during the first month and repeat important nutritional tips every-two-day for one month.
interventions.comparator: a leaflet containing general information on obesity and health impacts, tips on healthy eating and healthy life style for the preschool children given at the baseline

primaryOutcome.outcome: BMI gain assessed by the difference of BMI [weight (kg) divided by height (metre) squared] measured before (March) and after the 2 months school break (May
primaryOutcome.timepoint: two months (school vacation) after the randomisation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Child rearing during the school vacation using a questionnaire
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: two months (school vacation) after the randomisation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: - overweight defined as BMI-z-score > +1 of the WHO BMI reference for age and gender - attending the kindergartens in Hat Yai and Songkhla municipality - child has at least one parent or caregiver with a mobile phone
